review_blob: This is what the homeless buy off me when Im at work. Its really generic and cheap. Meh.

Heres a recipe for a new cocktail; 1 part water, 1 part Samuel Smith Oatmeal Stout, 1/4 part fig juice. I call it Big Rock Mcnallys Reserve! Seriously though, its inoffensive but nothing great. That said, I still buy it at the pub, because I love Samuel Smith Oatmeal Stout, and its cheap cause I live in the city where its brewed. I also give it points cause its one of the only stouts I can drink when Im super thirsty, cause its very smooth, like more smooth nitro than canned guinness. Theres nothing WRONG with this beer, but it doesnt stand out. Drink it! Its okay!

This is likely my favourite stout, possibly favourite beer at the moment. Its dark and smooth, which is  me all over. Bold coffee and charred something, dont quite know what but it works. If you wanna get into semi-widely distributed stouts, start with this, and expect to work your way down. I think this beer is flawless.

From the stoneware. Does the glass cost less? I feel silly now. 20 dollars for this is a lot of dollars. Not saying its bad, rather that I am poor.

Aaaaanyway.

I poured it into an english pint glass. 

To quote MC Paul Barman; 

"Jesus H. Christ, where H stands for Holy crap!". 

This is, in every facet, the STRONGEST beer Ive ever had. Its ridiculous. No, seriously, ridiculous. Its bitter and sour and sweet and thick and rich and deep and RIDICULOUS. Two inch thick fluffy angel food cake head, syrupy palate, and OPAQUE appearance, as in when I cleaned out the glass after I finished, the small amount of beer left mixed with the tap water to make and iced tea coloured solution that I was almost tempted to taste(I didnt!). Imagine pouring soy sauce into your hand, cause thats IDENTICAL to what this would look like doing likewise. Black licorice is the dominant taste in this stout, with a burnt cream aftertaste. The taste of the stout itself masks the large amount of alcohol in this beer; you really cant taste it at all. Did I enjoy it? Hell yes! Would I buy it again? Probably not. Its amazing, but its not easy to drink. Its like climbing everest; yeah it was fulfilling and rewarding and all that stuff, but you still wouldnt do it twice because it took a lot out of you. Plus, I cant afford it. Bottom line; you need to try it. 20 dollars for this experience is well worth it.

Poured from the pint-bottle into an English pint glass. It had a big head but it disappeared really quick. Anyways, I think it smells faintly of cookies! What, am I wrong? No! Its opinion damn it! I smell cookies, or at least SOMETHING baking. I cant quite put my finger on it right now. It tastes pretty bitter and you can really detect the alcohol in this but its not bad. I suppose Im being generous cause its pretty typical but what can I say? The bottle looks neat on my shelf. Typical beer in an atypical package that Im not too proud to say has impressed me more than it should a grown man. Oh well.
How bitter is this supposed to be? I think there might be some leftover dish soap in my glass. If not, this beer is just okay. If so, well then my face is certainly red.

Okay, Im not gonna bother lying. This is a classed-up malt liquor. Seriously. Thats it....That said, I have a soft spot for malt liquors, cause Im holding on desperately to my teen years, and Ill say taste-wise this is on par with the best of them. Price-wise however...not worth it. Tasty but expensive for what it is.

Poured from the bottle into one of their nifty gift pack tulip glasses. Pale clouded tea color. Nose was vegetables, straight fresh greens. Head is small, 2 cm and very little lacing left on the glass. Light carbonation, very alcohol-heavy feel. Taste was the same, sweet greens and alcohol. The fermentation floats about in the mix the whole time which I found really fun. Some of it even floats up into the head. Very very unique tripel, quite brilliant.

Poured from the bottle into a trappist glass. Nose was dry and sweet. Not a whole lot of head on this at all, so I guess I must have poured it wrong. What little head there was still left really nice legs throughout. Taste was sweet, apple-y and overall not very unique. Tastes like any other classy white to me. Not to say its bad! I liked it very much. Pretty carbonated sharp mouthfeel. Still, it needs a little something more to it.

Holy moly I didnt expect this beer to live up to the hype. My pal told me this was as good as any other Quad hed had but I havent ever had any other quad to my knowledge so I guess all quads must be delicious. 

Annnnyway, poured from the 750 into a snifter. This beer has a pretty big head and it stays around for awhile, the color was like deep walnut brown. Smelled very sweet, tasted way more interesting though. Like bread, sweet dough etc. I dont agree with the folks saying this tastes of fig and raisin cause I didnt catch any of the dull taste that comes with that deScription. 

This is allegedly the top favourite of the main beer guy at Kensington Wine Market in Calgary. I can understand why. Very delicious.

Had this in the bottle at Bottlescrew Bills. This beer is pretty bad. Tinny soapy taste and a gross feeling in your mouth. I dont recommend this to anyone. It looks like a normal beer though, so I guess its got that going for you. Im not gonna rate the appearance any higher than the default because I dont think this beer deserves over 1 as a total score. Its that bad.

Poured from the 750ml into a snifter. Cloudy woody brown appearance with a head thats quite large at first, but dissipates rather rapidly into a small one that will remain for the duration. Smells of dark fruit, tastes the same. Its VERY sweet, and the finish is actually quite spicy. Theres too much of something here. Overall, not my favourite from Unibroue, but not bad. I must admit I was a bit let down as this was my first Unibroue Annual. I thought theyd give it a bit of a better try than this to celebrate their own birthday. Still, not too bad, just not something Id prefer over their others. Til next year!

I dunno, I wouldnt say "nutty". Id say "woody". Yeah, nuts grow on trees, but so do apples, and this beer doesnt taste like apples. It tastes like wood, in a good way. Like a salmon roasted on cedar plank. Theres no other way I can put it. I think this beer is very good, and I think you should try it if you have the chance. Its one of the last bastions youll come across between a legit "brown ale" and a "brown ale" thats trying to be a Belgian brown.

I dont understand why this beer has such a low rating. Its like all the good of a domestic cheap pil with NONE of the bad. I truly deeply enjoy this beer any day of the week whatever Im doing. Its approachable and easy and inoffensive and just plain great. I love Big Rock and I love XO. 

Anyway, its a pale lager and its very bready tasting with no bitterness whatsoever. Moreover, this beer out of all beers is the best to drink if youre legitimately thirsty. Refreshing and delicious. Good job Calgary.

I love this stuff. Its like a get drunk beer when youre slightly less of a dirtbag than ghetto dudes who drink OE. Even though I love OE. Anyway...

Yeah theres a lot of choice between the unibroue and they all tend to remain within the same realm of price, but I enjoy Maudite the most out of all of them. Its DELICIOUS and INTERESTING without being ABRASIVE which some "good" beer tends to be on principle. You know what I mean? Like a good bear has to have something thats a bit "TOO" much to be considered good? Horsefeathers! Ive only tried pouring this out of the bottle once, and it looked like when you try to make your own iced tea out of tea you brew then refrigerate too quickly. Its all cloudy and translucent, and call me crazy but it seemed to taste better out of the bottle anyway. Keep it in the bottle guys, it works! But I digress. I love this beer. Its spicy and fruity and delicious. Better still, its GREAT beer at a GREAT price. Buy 3! Get drunk! Be classy!
UPDATED: OCT 25, 2006
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2006

Its all about expectations. If youre going into a 1.18L bottle of Colt45 8% thinking youre gonna enjoy a nice, refreshing, quiet, "sit at home watching cold case files" drink youre gonna be let down. If you go into this bottle thinking youre gonna end up laying down in places people dont usually lay down in by the end of the night, youre gonna be pleased. Im pretty sure every bottle comes with a complimentary rugby-playing troupe of frat boys. Smells like a bad wine. Deep yellow colour, very tiny head, serves no purpose. Taste isnt bitter at all, very sweet, very malty. The good thing about this beer is that its applicable to almost any situation in which youre looking to get drunk. Ive sipped this in the dead of an Alberta winter night, -25 celcius, and it was just the same as it always is. The funny thing is this is cheaper than a lot of beers that taste worse than it. The bottle is 2.5 pints of a strong, not all that bad tasting, malt liquor that costs $4.25 Canadian. Cheap drunk, thats what its there for.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2006

Poured from bottle. Deep yellow with a head that doesnt care enough to stick around and talk for awhile. Probably for the best, itd most likely hurt to get a bubble of this acid in your eye. Smelled like a silverware drawer, strongly. A good indicator of things to come. First sip was anticlimactic, little initial flavour, lasting aftertaste. Second sip caught me way off guard; Im guessing I wasnt paying attention enough the first time around because this go almost had me sick. Its as if someone took a paddle of raw tin and beat my tounge with it for a good hour. Absolutely no honey, either.  Not only that, but the carbonation was almost harsh. This isnt a BBQ beer, because we all know what happens when you mix spicy foods with bubbly drinks. To tell you the truth, the only thing this beer is good for is looking at, because it sure does pour pretty. Beware, evil wears the disguise of an alluring ale.

Bought this as Carling Black Label, no trace of "OKeefe" on the can, nevertheless I can only assume its the same thing. Didnt smell like anything, to me, which is probably good judging by what else I could gather from it. Very pale, foams up a lot if you dont crack it with caution. Tasted dull and metallic, nothing exciting at all but nothing offensive either; no character. If I didnt have the sense of taste I would swear I was drinking a can of water, as its actually very smooth and easy to drink, though I suspect thats because its lacking in almost everything you should find in a beer. I suppose my rating is pretty generous, but Im keeping in mind that this would actually be a pretty solid brew to take camping or to show up to a buddys house party with. Its cheap and it gets the job done.
beer_name: Carling Black Label Extra Old Stock (O Keefe Extra Old Stock)
